discussion.author: pi8027
discussion.comment: I just changed the title and resolved a conflict with #453. Since `order.v` has not been released yet, I'm still not sure how it should be recorded in CHANGELOG.

discussion.author: pi8027
discussion.comment: Hello @ggonthier, @CohenCyril, can we merge this before the next beta release? Thanks.

discussion.author: ybertot
discussion.comment: There remains a tag "Needs:documentation" that is confusing for release managers.  Can you please clarify, complete the work if needed, and merge?  @CohenCyril @ggonthier

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
> There remains a tag "Needs:documentation" that is confusing for release managers. Can you please clarify, complete the work if needed, and merge? @CohenCyril @ggonthier

I was a bit worried about the backward compatibility issues triggered by this PR, but after @pi8027's experiments, it does not not look so bad. I also thought @ggonthier could be opposed to it for the same reasons (or others?). I think we can merge for the beta and backtrack if this causes more trouble than relief to our users (in the former case, we could have distinct spec lemmas for the enhanced cased analysis instead of overloading `leqP`...).

review_discussion.author: pi8027
review_discussion.comment: Currently, this ordering is the same as in `order.v` but probably should be `(minn n m) (minn m n) (maxn n m) (maxn m n) (m <= n) (n < m)`.

review_discussion.author: pi8027
review_discussion.comment: So I did this documentation work. Since we decided to have a beta release, I think we should keep this entry in the beta version and remove it in the stable release.

commits.author: pi8027
commits.message: Extend comparison predicates for nat with minn and maxn

commits.author: pi8027
commits.message: Reorder arguments of comparison predicates in order.v as they should

commits.author: pi8027
commits.message: Document change on comparison predicates in order.v
